skill.name: neurokit2
skill.description: Comprehensive biosignal processing toolkit for analyzing physiological data including ECG, EEG, EDA, RSP, PPG, EMG, and EOG signals. Use this skill when processing cardiovascular signals, brain activity, electrodermal responses, respiratory patterns, muscle activity, or eye movements. Applicable for heart rate variability analysis, event-related potentials, complexity measures, autonomic nervous system assessment, psychophysiology research, and multi-modal physiological signal integration.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference files for the NeuroKit2 Python library. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond documentation reading. This is a guidance-only skill that teaches users how to use an external Python library.

content.value_statement: Processing physiological signals like ECG and EEG requires specialized algorithms for filtering, peak detection, and feature extraction. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and workflows for analyzing cardiovascular, neural, and autonomic signals using the NeuroKit2 Python library.
actual_capabilities: Process ECG signals for R-peak detection, cardiac analysis, and heart rate variability metrics
Analyze EEG signals for frequency bands, microstates, and source localization
Process electrodermal activity (EDA/GSR) for sympathetic nervous system assessment
Analyze respiratory signals for breathing rate, variability, and respiratory sinus arrhythmia
Process EMG signals for muscle activation detection and amplitude analysis
Integrate multi-modal physiological signals with unified processing pipelines
limitations: Requires external NeuroKit2 Python library installation (pip install neurokit2)
Does not provide data acquisition hardware integration
Quality of analysis depends on input signal quality and proper electrode placement
Advanced source localization requires MNE-Python and anatomical head models

use_cases.title: Multi-modal emotion studies
use_cases.description: Analyze heart rate, skin conductance, and facial EMG during emotional stimuli to study autonomic nervous system responses.

use_cases.title: EEG brain activity analysis
use_cases.description: Compute frequency band power, extract microstate sequences, and analyze brain dynamics during cognitive tasks.

use_cases.title: Cardiac HRV assessment
use_cases.description: Calculate comprehensive heart rate variability metrics for autonomic function assessment in clinical populations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic ECG workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me process an ECG signal to analyze heart rate variability. I have a signal sampled at 1000 Hz. Show me the complete pipeline including cleaning, R-peak detection, and computing HRV metrics in time, frequency, and nonlinear domains.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-signal integration
prompt_templates.prompt: I have simultaneous ECG, respiration, and EDA recordings. Show me how to process all signals together using the bio_process function and extract integrated features like respiratory sinus arrhythmia.

prompt_templates.title: Event-related analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to analyze physiological responses time-locked to stimulus events. Show me how to detect events, create epochs around them, and extract event-related features for ECG and EDA signals.

prompt_templates.title: EEG microstate analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me perform EEG microstate analysis on resting-state data. Include preprocessing, optimal number of states determination, segmentation, and computation of transition dynamics.

faq.question: What sampling rate do I need for different signals?
faq.answer: ECG and EEG require â‰¥250 Hz minimum (1000 Hz recommended). EDA needs â‰¥20 Hz. PPG requires â‰¥50 Hz. Higher rates capture more detail but increase data size.

faq.question: How long should recordings be for reliable analysis?
faq.answer: Basic heart rate: â‰¥10 seconds. HRV time domain: â‰¥60 seconds. HRV frequency domain: 2-5 minutes. Nonlinear HRV: 5+ minutes. Event-related: â‰¥30 trials per condition.

faq.question: Can I use NeuroKit2 with data from my device?
faq.answer: Yes. Import your data as NumPy arrays. Ensure consistent sampling rate across channels. Most biosignal acquisition systems export to formats compatible with NumPy.

faq.question: Is my physiological data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill contains only documentation. Processing happens locally using the NeuroKit2 Python library on your machine. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why is my peak detection failing?
faq.answer: Check signal quality first. Common issues: inverted ECG polarity, excessive noise, poor electrode contact, or sampling rate too low. Try alternative detection methods.

faq.question: How does this compare to Kubios or other HRV software?
faq.answer: NeuroKit2 provides similar core functionality with the advantage of being open-source, Python-based, and integrated with data science workflows. Kubios offers a GUI and some advanced features.
